result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward J Rogowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Ketamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(f).
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver LSD (<=1g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(f)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: counts two, three, four, five and any other sentence.  Credit for four days (4/5/2015 to 4/9/2014).

Court advised the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be Extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges  including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during the course of probation to the  to the probation agent.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession  and voting.

No alcohol.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescriptio taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No psosession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone or more than one phone number listed under the defendant's name at one time.
No psosession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine or any body armor.
No contact with any place where illegal drugs purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Geographic area restriction within area bordered on:  North by W. Wells Stree, Milwaukee, WI. South by W. Clybourn Stree, Milwaukee, WI. East by N. 22 Street, Milwaukee, WI.  West by N. 26 Street, Milwaukee, WI.

Notify DOC agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Dr.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by DOC agent, and notify the DOC agent of the pharmacy used.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  For the first year, defendant must attend at least one  alcohol and drug assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month.
**Conditions apply to all counts/conditions are the same exception is the condition time as ordered.

timeConds.notes:
To report on 6/8/2015 at 8:15 a.m.
Release for work, AODA treatment, and school.  Without good time.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Court will allow condition time to be served in Milwaukee County, Washington County or Ozaukee County.

***06-26-15/ Carolina STark***
As to the motion hearing the Court DENIES defense motion in part and GRANTS in part.
The Court DENIES defense motion to modify sentence to remove strong objection to electronic monitoring as set in Count 1.
The Court GRANTS defense motion to modify greater number of hours for release as follows:
release for work,  inmate work assignments,  and the Day Reporting Center.  
Work release allowed up to 15 hours per day of Huber release, ONLY for verified work hours at Cost of Wisconsin in Jackson, Wisconsin. 
Court denies defense request for release to obtain drivers license.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: counts three, four and five; but consecutive to count one and any other sentence.

This is STAYED to be used as follows for violations with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription:  to serve two months for first violation; 2 months for second; and two months for third.

records.addlTxt: Amended JOC reflects 06-26-15 Court order partially granting and partially denying motion for release priveleges
Court ordered when the AMENDED Judgment of Conviction is prepared, the closing clerk shall send a copy of the Judgment of Conviction to the Clerk of Courts for Ozaukee County.

Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt in court, defendant Edward J Rogowski not in court, in custody, waived his appearance for today's proceedings.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Motion hearing proceeded. Court DENIES Defense motion in part and GRANTS in part. Court DENIES defense motion to modify sentence to remove strong objection to electronic monitoring as set in count 1.  Court GRANTS defense motion to modify greater number of hours for release as follows: release for work, inmate work assignments, and The Day Reporting Center. Work release allowed up to 15 hours per day of Huber release, ONLY for verified work hours at Cost Of Wisconsin in Jackson, Wisconsin. Court DENIES defense request for release to obtain drivers license.
Parties notified, case set for Hearing on 06-26-2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Emergency Motion to Modify Sentence to Permit Consideraton for Release on Electronic Monitoring and to Modify Huber Privileges received and filed. tk
Court ordered when the Judgment of Conviction is prepared, the closing clerk shall send a copy of the Judgment of Conviction to the Clerk of Courts for Ozaukee County.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, consecutive to counts 2, 3, 4, 5 and any other sentence; with credit for 4 days (04-05-2015 to 04-09-2014) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS of condition time with release for work, AODA treatment, and school, without goodtime. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Court will allow condition time to be served in Milwaukee County, Washington County or Ozaukee County. Defendant is to report on 06-08-2015 at 8:15 am. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, concurrent with counts 3, 4, and 5 but consecutive to any count 1 and other sentence with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS of condition time with release for work, AODA treatment, and school, without goodtime. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is STAYED to use as follows:
*First violation with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription will result in 2 months. 
*Second violation with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription will result in 2 months. 
* Third violation with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription will result in 2 months.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, concurrent with counts 2, 4 and 5 but consecutive to count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, concurrent with counts 2, 3, and 5 but consecutive to count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 5:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, concurrent with counts 2, 3, and 4 but consecutive to count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- For the first year, Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Maintain Full Time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- No contact with any place where illegal drugs purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
- Geographic area restriction within area bordered on:
	* North by W. Wells Street, Milwaukee WI
	* South by W. Clybourn Street, Milwaukee WI
	* East by N. 22nd Street, Milwaukee WI
	* West by N. 26th Street, Milwaukee WI
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

AS TO COUNT 2,3,4,5 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Received and filed. tk

Defendant Edward J Rogowski in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Court grants consolidate of cases.
 Amended Information filed. On motion of the State, Court orders charges ADDING from Ozaukee County case 15CF65.
COUNT 2: Delivery Controlled Substance (Tetrahydrocannabinols) (=<200 Grams or 4 or Fewer Plants)(Formerly Ct 1 in Ozaukee Case 15CF65) contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(1(h)1, 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony. 
COUNT 3: Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3G) - PTAC, As A Party To A Crime (Formerly Ct 2 in Ozaukee Case 15CF65)  contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections  961.41(1)(hm1, 939.50(3)(f), 939.05, a Class F Felony.
COUNT 4: Delivery Controlled Substance (LSD) (1 Gram or less) - PTAC, As A Party To A Crime (Formerly Ct 3 in Ozaukee Case 15CF65)  contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(1)(f)1, 939.50(3)(g), 939.05 , a Class G Felony. 
COUNT 5: Delivery Controlled Substance  (Tetrahydrocannabinols) (= 200 Grams or 4 or Fewer Plants)(Formerly Ct 6 in Ozaukee Case 15CF65)  contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(1)(h)1, 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

AS TO COUNT  1-
